text: Kind words can be short and easy to speak but their echoes are truly endless.
author: Mother Teresa

text: The only way to have a friend is to be one.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Success is never final. Failure is never fatal. It is courage that counts.
author: Winston Churchill

text: In life, there are no mistakes, only lessons.
author: Vic Johnson

text: It's not what happens to you, it's what you do about it.
author: W. Mitchell

text: Beauty captures attention but personality captures the heart.
author: Anonymous

text: You don't have to be great to start but you have to start to be great.
author: Anonymous

text: If you can't say something nice, say nothing.
author: Anonymous

text: Great minds discuss ideas, average minds discuss events, small minds discuss people.
author: Anonymous

text: There was never a good war or a bad peace.
author: Anonymous

text: It's not how good you are. It's how good you want to be.
author: Paul Arden

text: Study while others are sleeping; work while others are loafing; prepare while others are playing; and dream while others are wishing.
author: William Arthur Ward

text: It's not that I'm so smart; it's just that I stay with problems longer.
author: Albert Einstein

text: It does not matter how slow you go so long as you do not stop.
author: Confucius

text: Never let anyone tell you that you can't do something, not even yourself.
author: Anonymous

text: People often say that motivation doesn't last. Well, neither does bathing -- that's why we recommend it daily.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: When any one lies to you, its not his fault. Actually its yours, because you did not give him the proper space to tell the truth!
author: Anonymous

text: A dreamer is one who can only find his way by moonlight, and his punishment is that he sees the dawn before the rest of the world!
author: Anonymous

text: Be kinder than necessary because everyone you meet is fighting some kind of battle.
author: Aristotle

text: A sharp tongue can cut your own throat.
author: Anonymous

text: If you want your dreams to come true, you musn't oversleep
author: Anonymous

text: Of all the things you wear, your expression is the most important.
author: Anonymous

text: The happiness of your life depends on the quality of your thoughts.
author: Anonymous

text: Be Curious, not judgemental.
author: Walt Whiteman

text: Our prime purpose in this life is to help others and if you can help them, at lease don't hurt them.
author: Dalai Lama

text: Today YOU are YOU, that is truer than true. There is no one alive, who is YOUER than YOU.
author: Dr. Seuss

text: Dreams don't work unless you do.
author: Anonymous

text: If you are tired of starting over, stop giving up.
author: Anonymous

text: Great thoughts reduced to practice become great acts.
author: William Hazlitt, essayist

text: Good men must not obey the laws too well.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson, writer and philosopher

text: When love is not madness, it is not love.
author: Pedro Calderon de la Barca, poet and dramatist

text: A beautiful thing is never perfect.
author: Egyptian proverb

text: Insane people are always sure that they are fine. It is only the sane people who are willing to admit that they are crazy.
author: Nora Ephron, novelist

text: Thoughts are the shadows of our feelings -- always darker, emptier, and simpler.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche, philosopher

text: If people are good only because they fear punishment, and hope for reward, then we are a sorry lot indeed.
author: Albert Einstein, physicist, Nobel laureate

text: Do not condemn the judgment of another because it differs from your own. You may both be wrong.
author: Dandamis, sage

text: The highest result of education is tolerance.
author: Helen Keller, author and lecturer

text: One cannot do right in one department of life whilst he is occupied in doing wrong in any other department. Life is one indivisible whole.
author: Gandhiji

text: An age is called Dark not because the light fails to shine, but because people refuse to see it.
author: James Albert Michener, novelist

text: A strong and positive attitude creates more miracles than any other thing.
author: Anonymous

text: Here is the test to find whether your mission on earth is finished: If you're alive, it isn't.
author: Richard Bach

text: Sometimes I wish I were a little kid again; skinned knees are easier to fix than broken hearts.
author: Anonymous

text: I speak the truth not so much as I would, but as much as I dare, and I dare a little more as I grow older.
author: Michel de Montaigne, essayist

text: I am I plus my surroundings and if I do not preserve the latter, I do not preserve myself.
author: Jose Ortega Y Gasset, philosopher and essayist

text: Knowing trees, I understand the meaning of patience. Knowing grass, I can appreciate persistence.
author: Hal Borland, journalist

text: I need someone to protect me from all the measures they take in order to protect me.
author: Banksy, street artist

text: Happiness is not a goal; it is a by-product.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt, diplomat and author

text: 'Truth is
author: everyone's going to hurt you,

text: you just gotta find the ones worth suffering for!
author: Bob Marley

text: Each morning puts a man on trial and each evening passes judgment.
author: Roy L. Smith

text: Try to be "good", you'll be judged. Try to be yourself, you'll be criticized. Better to choose the second option and move ahead; God will never let you down.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: Pride is beneficial in small, though injurious in large, quantities. No man who is not pleased with himself, even in a personal sense, can please others.
author: Frederick Saunders, librarian and essayist

text: The lust for comfort murders the passions of the soul.
author: Khalil Gibran, mystic, poet, and artist

text: Writing is a way of talking without being interrupted.
author: Jules Renard, author

text: When love and skill work together, expect a masterpiece.
author: John Ruskin, author, art critic, and social reformer

text: The game of life is the game of boomerangs. Our thoughts, deeds and words return to us sooner or later with astounding accuracy.
author: Florence Scovel Shinn, writer, artist and teacher

text: The test of our progress is not whether we add more to the abundance of those who have much, it is whether we provide enough for those who have too little.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt, 32nd US President

text: Several excuses are always less convincing than one.
author: Aldous Huxley, novelist

text: We are not the same persons this year as last; nor are those we love. It is a happy chance if we, changing, continue to love a changed person.
author: William Somerset Maugham, writer

text: We judge ourselves by what we feel capable of doing, while others judge us by what we have already done.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow, poet

text: A teacher is one who makes himself progressively unnecessary.
author: Thomas Carruthers

text: In this world there are only two tragedies. One is not getting what one wants, and the other is getting it. The last is much the worst.
author: Oscar Wilde, writer

text: What do we live for, if it is not to make life less difficult to each other
author: George Eliot (Mary Ann Evans), novelist

text: Experience is not what happens to a man; it is what a man does with what happens to him.
author: Aldous Huxley, novelist

text: Action is the real measure of intelligence.  -
author: Napoleon Hill

text: I have never met a man so ignorant that I couldn't learn something from him.
author: Galileo Galilei, physicist and astronomer

text: Clear thinking requires courage rather than intelligence.
author: Thomas Szasz, author, professor of psychiatry

text: Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication.
author: Leonardo da Vinci, painter, engineer, musician, and scientist

text: Be the master of your will and the slave of your conscience.
author: Hasidic saying

text: We're here to put a dent in the universe.
author: Steve Jobs, entrepreneur and inventor

text: A problem well stated is a problem half solved.
author: Charles F. Kettering, inventor and engineer

text: You can become blind by seeing each day as a similar one. Each day is a different one, each day brings a miracle of its own. It's just a matter of paying attention to this miracle.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: Don't waste time with explanations. People only hear what they want to hear.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: One day, you will wake up and there won't be any more time to do things you've always wanted. DO IT NOW.
author: Paulo Coelho.

text: When you want something, the whole universe conspires to help you.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: Waiting hurts. Forgetting hurts. But not knowing which decision to take can sometimes be the most painful
author: Paulo Coelho

text: We need to forget what we think we are so that we can really become what we are.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: When we least expect it, life sets us a challenge to test our courage and willingness to change.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: If you are brave enough to say goodbye , life will reward you with a new 'hello'.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: Minds are like parachutes ' they only function when they are open.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: A life without cause is a life without effect.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: Enjoy your magic moment today, as it will not be here tomorrow.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: Dreams are not negotiable.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: A child can teach an adult three things: to be happy for no reason, to always be busy with something, and to know how to demand with all his might that which he desires.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: Life is too short, for me to allow myself the luxury of living it so badly.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: There are moments when troubles enter our lives and we can do nothing to avoid them. But they are there for a reason. Only when we have overcome them will we understand why they were there.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: There is always a gap between intention and action.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: There is only one thing that makes a dream impossible to achieve, fear of failure.
author: Paulo Coelho.

text: The heaviest thing you can carry is a grudge.
author: Anonymous

text: One thing you can give and still keep is your word.
author: Anonymous

text: You lie the loudest when you lie to yourself.
author: Anonymous

text: If you lack the courage to start, you have already finished.
author: Anonymous

text: One thing you can't recycle is wasted time.
author: Anonymous

text: Ideas won't work unless ' You' do
author: Anonymous

text: The pursuit of happiness is the chase of a lifetime!
author: Anonymous

text: It is never too late to become what you might have been.
author: Anonymous

text: Life is too short to wake up with regrets. So love the people who treat you right. Forget about the ones who don't.  Believe everything happens for a reason. If you get a second chance, grab it with both hands. If it changes your life, let it.
author: Anonymous

text: Nobody said life would be easy, they just promised it would be worth it.
author: Anonymous

text: Forgiveness means it finally becomes unimportant that you hit back
author: anne lamott

text: To know when to go away & when to come closer is the key to any lasting relationship.
author: Domenico Estrada

text: Waste no time arguing about what a good man should be. Be one.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: Art should comfort disturbed & disturb the comfortable.
author: Cesar Cruz

text: Win as if u were used to it & lose as if you enjoyed it for a change.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Appreciation heals divisions, builds bridges and adds to our strengths; it helps us with self
author: affirmation, it brings positive forces into play & it also gives us the 'feel good' feeling.

text: Saying goodbye doesn't mean anything. It's the time we spent together that matters, not how we left it.
author: Anonymous

text: Be selective in your battles, sometimes peace is better than being right.
author: Anonymous

text: In order to succeed, your desire for success should be greater than your fear of failure.
author: Bill Cosby.

text: Right actions for the future are the best apologies for wrong ones in the past.
author: Anonymous

text: Learn from yesterday, live for today, hope for tomorrow. The important thing is not to stop questioning.
author: Albert Einstein.

text: Communication to a relationship is like oxygen to life. Without it, it dies.
author: Anonymous

text: Success is not measured by what you accomplish, but by the opposition you have encountered, and the courage with which you have maintained the struggle against overwhelming odds.
author: Orison Swett Marden

text: In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life; it goes on.
author: Robert Frost

text: Happiness is the only good. The time to be happy is now. The place to be happy is here. The way to be happy is to make others so.
author: Robert Green Ingersoll

text: Self-pity is our worst enemy & if we yield to it, we can never do anything wise in this world.
author: Helen Keller.

text: Your belief becomes your thoughts; your thoughts become your words; your words become your action; your action becomes your habits; your habits become your value & your value becomes your destiny.
author: Anonymous

text: Focused mind power is one of the strongest forces on the earth.
author: Anonymous

text: The most important thing in communication is to hear what is not being said.
author: Peter Drucker

text: Experience is not a skill; it is an attitude.
author: Ralph Marson.

text: Don't judge each day by the harvest you reap but by the seeds that you plant.
author: R L Stevenson

text: Human behavior flows from three main sources: desire, emotion & knowledge.
author: Plato

text: Always bear in mind that your own resolution to succeed is more important than any other.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: Don't cry because it's over; smile because it happened.
author: Dr. Seuss

text: The two hardest things to say in life are hello for the first time and goodbye for the last.
author: Moira Rogers

text: Shallow men believe in luck, strong men believe in cause and effect.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Life is not measured by the number of breaths we take, but by the moments that take our breath away.
author: Maya Angelou

text: I find that the harder I work, the more luck I seem to have.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: The secret of happiness is to make others believe they are the cause of it.
author: Al Batt.

text: Being strong means rejoicing in who you are, complete with imperfections.
author: Margaret Woodhouse

text: What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson.

text: All change is hard at first, messy in the middle and so gorgeous at the end.
author: Robin Sharma

text: Live the life you think you deserve.
author: Anonymous

text: Be faithful in small things because it is in them that your strength lies.
author: Mother Teresa

text: Have no fear of perfection, as practice doesn't make you perfect, it reduces the imperfection.
author: Anonymous

text: Life is life a road trip, enjoy each day and don't carry too much baggage.
author: Anonymous

text: The struggle you are in today is developing the strength you need for tomorrow.
author: Anonymous

text: Maturity comes when you stop making excuses and start making changes.
author: Anonymous

text: Be an encourager. The world has plenty of critics already.
author: Anonymous

text: Attract what you expect, reflect what you desire, become what you respect, mirror what you admire.
author: Anonymous

text: Today is better than yesterday.
author: Anonymous

text: Take care of your thoughts when you are alone and take care of your words when you are with people.
author: Anonymous

text: You have a choice each & every single day, I choose to feel blessed, I choose to feel grateful, I choose to be excited, I choose to be thankful, I choose to be happy.
author: Anonymous

text: Give more than you get & you'll receive more that you've imagined.
author: Robin Sharma

text: People who love to eat are always the best people.
author: Julia Child

text: Talk to yourself once in a day otherwise you may miss meeting an excellent person in this world.
author: Swami Vivekanand.

text: How others see you is not important, how you see yourself mean everything.
author: Anonymous

text: Happiness is viral, go infect someone.
author: Anonymous

text: The oldest, shortest words  'yes' and 'no'  are those which require the most thought.
author: Pythagoras.

text: If you correct your mind, the rest of your life will fall into place.
author: Lao Tzu

text: It takes a huge effort to free yourself from memory.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: Anyone who loves in the expectation of being loved in return is wasting their time.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: Life has many ways of testing a person's will, either by having nothing happen at all or by having everything happen all at once.
author: Paulo Coelho

text: The moment we begin to seek love, love begins to seek us, and to save us.
author: Paulo Coelho.

text: True love doesn't just fill your heart, it overflows into your whole body & soul.
author: Anonymous

text: Often the worst of times are what lead us to the best of times because all we go through inspires us to grow into our very best self.
author: Anonymous

text: Happiness is not something that you get in life. Happiness is something that you bring to life.
author: Anonymous

text: Be crazy, be stupid, be silly, be weird, be whatever, because life is too short to be anything but happy.
author: Anonymous

text: Smile, you don't own all the problems in the world.
author: Anonymous

text: Hugging is a good medicine. It transfers energy and gives the person hugged an emotional lift. It can say things you don't have the words for. The nicest thing about a hug is that you usually can't give one without getting one.
author: Anonymous

text: A man can fail many times, but he isn't a failure until he begins to blame someone else.
author: John Burroughs

text: You can't start the next chapter of your life if you keep re
author: reading the last one.

text: Nothing great was ever achieved without enthusiasm.
author: Anonymous

text: Living is a gift & we must make the best of it, every day of our lives.
author: Anonymous

text: In a sound body rests a sound mind.
author: Anonymous

text: Those who don't make time for exercise must eventually make time for illness.
author: Anonymous

text: Genius is 1% inspiration and 99% perspiration.
author: Thomas Edison

text: You are here to enrich the world.
author: Anonymous

text: The words that enlighten the soul are more precious than jewels.
author: Anonymous

text: A diary is a place where you record events while a journal is a place where you analyze and evaluate them. Keep a journal.
author: Robin Sharma

text: Perhaps the most valuable result of all education is the ability to make yourself do the things you have to do, whether you like it or not.
author: Aristotle

text: The hand that gives is the hand that gathers.
author: Anonymous

text: The real secret to getting things done is knowing what things need to be left undone. Focus on the worthy.
author: Anonymous

text: So long as you live, keep learning how to live.
author: Seneca

text: How high you will rise in your life will be determined not by how hard you work but by how well you think.
author: Anonymous

text: If you have not read today, you have not really lived today.
author: Anonymous

text: There are no great acts. There are only small acts done with great love.
author: Mother Teresa

text: The smallest of action is always better than the boldest of intentions. Practice to act.
author: Anonymous

text: Without the rich heart, wealth is an ugly beggar.
author: Emerson

text: One of the deepest of all the human hungers is the need to be understood, cherished and honored.
author: Anonymous

text: Wisdom is knowing what to do next, skill is knowing how to do it and virtue is doing it.
author: David Starr Jordan

text: Enjoy the path, not just the reward. 'The reward for a thing well done, is to have done it.'
author: Emerson.

text: The first step to eliminating a negative habit is to become aware of it, for awareness is the first step to change.
author: Anonymous

text: There is a difference between simply existing & truly living. There is a distinction between simply surviving & really thriving.
author: Anonymous

text: Develop your talents
author: Are you using the best within you to its fullest capacity' If not, you are not only doing yourself a disservice, you are doing the world, and all those within it who could benefit from your unique talents, a disservice.

text: Connect with nature ' When I admire the wonder of a sunset or the beauty of the moon, my soul expands in worship of the Creator.
author: Gandhiji

text: Remember the rule of 21 ' We first make our habits & then our habits make us.
author: John Dryden

text: Forgiveness ' Forgiveness is the fragrance that the violet sheds on the heel that crushed it.
author: Mark Twain.

text: Every minute you devote to thinking about someone who has wronged you is a minute you have stolen from a much worthier pursuit: attracting those people who will help you.
author: Anonymous

text: Create a pure environment
author: Your thoughts form your world. Take a look at your environment.

text: Your thoughts are shaped by the people you associated with, by the books you read, by the words you speak and by your daily physical surroundings.
author: Anonymous

text: Count your blessings ' It is easy to magnify our problems and lose sight of the many blessings we all have to be so very grateful for.
author: Anonymous

text: Seeing what others don't have keeps us awake to all the good things we do have, it prevents us from taking things for granted and helps us make a difference in the lives of people who really need us.
author: Anonymous

text: Find 3 great friends ' There is nothing in this world more valuable than friendship.
author: Anonymous

text: If you plant the seeds of friendship, you are bound to receive a rich harvest of great friends for every human being has a deep need for affection and most people will be delighted you took the initiative.
author: Anonymous

text: 'Take your life into your own hands and what happens' A terrible thing: no one to blame.'
author: Erica Jong

text: Increase your value ' Not by how hard your work but by how much value you add to the world around you.
author: Anonymous

text: Savor the simple stuff ' our best memories come form life's simplest things.
author: Anonymous

text: One of the most tragic things I know about human nature is that all of us tend to put off living. We are all dreaming of some magical rose garden over the horizon instead of enjoying the roses that are blooming outside our windows today.
author: Dale Carnegie

text: See your day as your life ' You change you life the second you make a decision from the depths of your heart to be a better, more dedicated human being.
author: Anonymous

text: Life's greatest setbacks always reveal life's biggest blessings.
author: Anonymous

text: Be humble ' The tree that has the most fruits is the tree that bends to the ground. The more you are as a person, the less you need to prove yourself to others.
author: Anonymous

text: Make a vow of silence ' Staying quite for even short periods of time builds willpower and self
author: control because you exert force on your will by not giving in to the impulse to talk.

text: Recreation must restore you & bring you back to life.
author: Anonymous

text: My belief is not that the good body by any bodily excellence improves the soul, but. On the contrary, that the good soul, by her own excellence, improves the body as far as this may be possible.
author: Plato.

text: Stop thinking tiny thoughts. ' Nurture your mind with great thoughts, for you will never go any higher than you think.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

text: God, give us the grace to accept with serenity the things that cannot be changed, courage to change the things which should be changed, and the wisdom to distinguish one from the other.
author: The Serenity Prayer

text: It's never to late to become the person you always wanted to be.
author: Anonymous

text: Man must not allow the clock and the calendar to blind him to the fact that each moment of his life is a miracle and a mystery.
author: H. G. Wells

text: A great quote contains a wealth of wisdom in a single line.
author: Anonymous

text: This world was built by people who felt discontent with the way things were and knew they could do better.
author: Anonymous

text: Being a leader is not about being liked. It's about doing what's right.
author: Anonymous

text: The ultimate advantage of your enterprise comes down to a single imperative ' your ability to grow and develop leaders faster than your competition.
author: Anonymous

text: Every time you say yes to something that is unimportant, you say no to something that is important.
author: Anonymous

text: The essential difference between emotion & reason is that emotion leads to action while reason leads to conclusion. Human beings move when their emotions are moved.
author: Anonymous

text: Clarity precedes success.
author: Anonymous

text: There is nothing so useless as doing efficiently that which should not be done at all.
author: Peter Drucker

text: Insanity is doing the same things but expecting different results.
author: Einstein.

text: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today.
author: Franklin Roosevelt

text: Faith doesn't make things easy, it makes them possible.
author: Anonymous
